benchmark_details.name: EconNLI (Economic Natural Language Inference)
benchmark_details.overview: EconNLI is a dataset designed to evaluate Large Language Modelsâ€™ knowledge and reasoning abilities in the economic domain, specifically focusing on natural language inference about economic events.
benchmark_details.data_type: sentence pairs of premise and hypothesis

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To systematically evaluate the economic reasoning abilities of Large Language Models using natural language inference.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The study does not address the reasoning ability of LLMs in non-economic domains.

data.source: Wikipedia corpus on economics and finance
data.annotation: Annotated by human experts and assisted by language models.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on model predictions compared to ground truth labels.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores in accuracy and F1 indicate better performance in reasoning tasks.
methodology.baseline_results: LLAMA2 models achieved F1 scores around 0.87, while BERT and FinBERT struggled with scores below 0.8.
methodology.validation: A validation set was created by randomly sampling 10% of the training data.
